title: repo.data
text: Packages required package might dependencies minimal versions requirements. maintainers developers might wonder oldest version recursive package users required . useful developing packages remain compatible old versions R packages. package_dependencies() identify minimal version required dependency. version required dependencies NA used. can identify packages required lower version one dependencies Increasing version requirements ggeasy won’t affect users already versions installed required dependencies. can also interested since can users install package. can two possible answers: - Since published/release repositories - maintainer developers careful requirements might available earlier. can use package_date() get answers: important? first one important know hasn’t updated long time. second one helps estimate can installed old systems without updating anything else. date dependencies available closer published date, users need updated systems dependencies.
code: pd <- package_dependencies("ggeasy") head(pd) #>        Name Version    Type   Op Package #> 1       cli   3.4.0 Imports   >=    <NA> #> 2 lifecycle   1.0.3 Imports   >=    <NA> #> 3         R   4.1.0 Depends   >=    <NA> #> 4     rlang   1.1.0 Imports   >=    <NA> #> 5     utils    <NA> Imports <NA>    <NA> #> 6   ggplot2    <NA> Imports <NA>  ggeasy # Discover the requirements that can be upgraded update_dependencies("ggeasy") #>       Name Version #> 1 testthat   3.2.0 package_date("ggeasy") #>                 Published            deps_available  #> "2025-06-15 04:40:04 UTC" "2021-05-18 07:05:22 UTC"

title: repo.data
text: Help pages found via alias, user press ?word searches alias. Checking existing alias might help find packages reduce confusion help pages. example two packages alias internal functions point file.
code: alias <- cran_alias(c("fect", "gsynth")) dup_alias <- duplicated_alias(alias) head(dup_alias) #>                     Target Package             Source #> 1        _gsynth_beta_iter    fect   fect-internal.Rd #> 2        _gsynth_beta_iter  gsynth gsynth-internal.Rd #> 3      _gsynth_data_ub_adj    fect   fect-internal.Rd #> 4      _gsynth_data_ub_adj  gsynth gsynth-internal.Rd #> 5 _gsynth_fe_ad_covar_iter    fect   fect-internal.Rd #> 6 _gsynth_fe_ad_covar_iter  gsynth gsynth-internal.Rd

title: repo.data
text: Often helpful link help pages : - Pages linked pages - Pages linked pages. addition help pages well connected pages linked link without connecting help pages package packages. retrieve help pages forming clique requires suggested package igraph. one length mean pages linked rest package. Sometimes even links exists might resolve correctly html version. example link help page package strong dependency list. output link resolved correctly package independently installed machine.
code: pkg <- "BaseSet" head(cran_help_pages_wo_links(pkg)) #> Retrieving base_aliases, this might take a bit. #> Caching results to be faster next call in this session. #> [1] NA head(cran_help_pages_not_linked(pkg)) #> [1] NA cliques <- cran_help_cliques(pkg) #> Retrieving cran_rdxrefs, this might take a bit. #> Caching results to be faster next call in this session. #> Warning: Some links are distinct depending on the OS. # Number of help pages connected if (length(cliques) != 1) {     table(cliques$n)  } #>  #>    1  #> 4047 cran_help_pages_links_wo_deps(pkg) #> [1] Package Source  Anchor  Target  #> <0 rows> (or 0-length row.names)

title: repo.data
text: wish know packages available CRAN given date can use: might helpful know available old project feature given package wasn’t used. Maybe wasn’t available given date!
code: cs <- cran_snapshot(as.Date("2020-01-31")) #> Warning: There are 4 packages both archived and published #> This indicate manual CRAN intervention. #> Retrieving comments, this might take a bit. #> Caching results to be faster next call in this session. nrow(cs) #> [1] 102839

title: repo.data
text: working might good update packages. decide needed maybe ’d like know packages last updated system? uses sessionInfo() output find date last installation. hood uses function arbitrary packages versions: first date packages requested version number (available). Currently packages can release higher version numbers (can easily checked old.packages()). answer original question section can use:
code: cran_session() #> [1] "2025-09-25 09:30:07 CEST" versions <- data.frame(Package = c("dplyr", "Rcpp", "rlang"),                        Version = c("1.1.4", "0.8.9", NA)) cran_date(versions) #> [1] "2023-11-17 16:50:03 CET" cran_date(installed.packages())

title: repo.data
text: ever wonder packages risk archived can use cran_doom(): website dedicated track provide information new version submissions CRAN fix . participate cranhaven.org dashboard (project). Note package archived can brought back repository.
code: cd <- cran_doom(bioc = TRUE) #> Retrieving CRAN_db, this might take a bit. #> Caching results to be faster next call in this session. #> Retrieving bioc_available_release, this might take a bit. #> Caching results to be faster next call in this session. if (length(cd) != 1) {     cd[c("time_till_last", "last_archived", "npackages")]     knitr::kable(head(cd$details)) }

Version   User   Size   Status #> 1            A3 2013-02-07 10:00:29   0.9.1 hornik  45252 archived #> 2            A3 2013-03-26 19:58:40   0.9.2 ligges  45907 archived #> 3            A3 2015-08-16 23:05:54   1.0.0 hornik  42810 archived #> 4 AalenJohansen 2023-03-01 11:42:11     1.0 ligges 165057  current #> 5       aamatch 2025-06-24 11:40:05   0.3.7 ligges 222104  current #> 6          aaMI 2005-06-24 17:55:17   1.0-0   root   2968 archived cc <- cran_comments() #> Retrieving comments, this might take a bit. #> Caching results to be faster next call in this session. head(cc) #>    package #> 1       A3 #> 2    aaSEA #> 3      aba #> 4   abbyyR #> 5   abcADM #> 6 abcdeFBA #>                                                                          comment #> 1         Archived on 2025-06-13 as issues were not corrected despite reminders. #> 2 Archived on 2022-06-21 as check problems were not corrected despite reminders. #> 3           Archived on 2022-03-27 as check problems were not corrected in time. #> 4                            Archived on 2023-11-03 at the maintainer's request. #> 5                   Archived on 2023-03-02 as issues were not corrected in time. #> 6 archived #> 5 2023-03-02 archived #> 6 2022-03-07 archived cran_session(session = sessionInfo()) #> [1] "2025-08-27 18:40:06 CEST" ip <- installed.packages() cran_date(ip) #> Warning in cran_archive(versions[, "Package"]): Omitting packages airway, alabaster.base, alabaster.matrix, alabaster.ranges, alabaster.sce, alabaster.schemas, alabaster.se, annotate, AnnotationDbi, title: Find earliest date of compatibility — package_date
code: package_date("ABACUS") #>                 Published            deps_available  #> "2019-09-20 05:40:07 UTC" "2019-04-12 00:00:00 UTC"  package_date("paramtest") #>                 Published            deps_available  #> "2025-03-24 18:50:04 UTC"                        NA  package_date("Seurat") # Dependencies on packages not on CRAN #>                 Published            deps_available  #> "2025-04-23 20:10:03 UTC" "2024-05-08 00:00:00 UTC"  package_date("afmToolkit") # Dependency was removed from CRAN #>                 Published            deps_available  #> "2025-09-23 08:40:12 UTC" "2022-04-13 00:00:00 UTC"
